grounds.description1: Translators can be authorised on three different ways:
grounds.description2: The first two groups renew their authorised translator’s rights at intervals of 5 years. Authorisation without a time limit is granted to an official translator. The Finnish National Agency for Education contacts the authorised translators approximately three months prior the expiration date of the five-year-term. If the authorisation expires, the translator will be removed from the public search engine. Authorisation can be extended upon application at any time.
grounds.ground2: higher education studies in translation, completed as part a master’s degree (60 ETCS, including 6 ETCS in authorised translation)

handlingPurpose.description1: The Register of authorised translators contains the details of authorised translators to whom the Examination Board of Authorised Translators has granted the right to practice as an authorised translator upon application.
handlingPurpose.description2: Authorised translators can be searched for in the Register's public search engine and a contact request for a translation assignment can be left to them via the register. It is also possible to conduct searches from the Register without leaving a contact request.
handlingPurpose.description3: The information recorded and processed in the register is personal data that are necessary for administrating the authorisations and managing the above-mentioned contact requests and needs to make changes.
handlingPurpose.description4: The permission to publish is requested from the data subject beforehand and, in the same context, this form is used to give an account of how the data are processed.
handlingPurpose.heading: Legal basis and purpose of handling personal data

group1.description: The data are kept for 6 months.

group3.description: The data are deleted from the register without undue delay and at the latest two months after the authorisation has ended or it has been cancelled. The service’s personal data retention periods are in accordance with the retention periods in the filing plan and the information management plan. Documents whose retention period has expired are deleted from the system on an annual basis.

receivers.description1: Under the Act on the openness of government activities (621/1999), the Finnish National Agency for Education must give access to a public document to the person requesting it even if the document contains personal data. The delivery or disclosure of confidential information requires a special ground: the status as one of the parties, a statutory right to obtain the information, or consent from the person protected by the secrecy provision.
receivers.description2: Personal data can be disclosed for scientific or historical research or for statistical purposes on the conditions referred to 4 § of the Data Protection Act (1050/2018).
receivers.description3: The service providers of the information system (processors of personal data) are given access to the personal data in the register to the extent determined by the Finnish National Agency for Education.
receivers.description4: No data are disclosed to direct marketing.
receivers.heading: Recipients or categories of recipients of personal data

registeredRights.description1: The data subject has the right to receive a confirmation from the controller stating that the data subject's personal data are processed or not processed. On request, the controller must provide a copy of the personal data processed in the file.
registeredRights.description2: The data subject has the right to demand rectification of false inaccurate data by the data controller without undue delay. The data subject must identify the data which they require to be corrected and which in their view are correct, indicate how they wish the data to be corrected, and justify their views.
registeredRights.description3: If the processing is based on Article 6(1)(a) or Article 9(2)(a) of the General Data Protection Regulation, i.e. on consent given by the data subject, the data subject has the right to have the data erased.
registeredRights.description4: The data subject has the right to restrict the processing of their data in certain situations.
registeredRights.description5: The controller must communicate any rectification or erasure of your personal data or restriction of processing to each recipient to whom the personal data have been disclosed, if data are disclosed to third parties.
registeredRights.description6: The data subject has the right to have the data transferred form one system to another if processing is carried out automatically.
registeredRights.description7: Any requests related to exercising these rights should be addressed to the contact person for the file: Finnish National Agency for Education, P.O. Box 380, 00531 Helsinki, Finland. The data subject must attach the information needed to locate the data to their access request (name and personal identity code).
registeredRights.description8: If less than one year has passed from the right to access personal data exercised by the data subject, the controller may charge a fee based on the administrative costs caused by providing the data (Article 12 [5]).
registeredRights.heading: Data subject’s rights
